original: paramaṃ puruṣaṃ divyaṃ yāti pārthānucintayan ////
analyzed: paramam puruṣam divyam yāti pārtha anucintayan
translated: thinking of the Supreme Person, the Divine, one goes, O son of Pṛthā.

original: śrīdharaḥ santatasmaraṇasya cābhyāso 'ntaraṅgasādhanam iti darśayann āha abhyāsayogeneti /
translated: Śrīdhara: Showing that the inner means is the practice of continuous remembrance, he says with the yoga of practice.

original: abhyāsaḥ sajātīyapratyayapravāhaḥ /
analyzed: abhyāsaḥ sajātīya pratyaya pravāhaḥ
translated: Practice is the flow of homogeneous cognitions.

original: sa eva yoga upāyaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva yogaḥ upāyaḥ
translated: That itself is the means, the yoga.

original: tena yuktenaikāgreṇa /
analyzed: tena yuktena ekāgreṇa
translated: By that, which is united with, concentrated on,

original: ataeva nānyaṃ viṣayaṃ gantuṃ śīlaṃ yasya /
analyzed: ataeva na anyam viṣayam gantum śīlam yasya
translated: and therefore, which has the habit of not going to any other object.

original: tena cetasā /
analyzed: tena cetasā
translated: By that mind.

original: divyaṃ dyotanātmakaṃ paramaṃ puruṣaṃ parameśvaram anucintayan he pārtha tam eva yātīti ////
analyzed: divyam dyotana ātmakam paramam puruṣam parameśvaram anucintayan he pārtha tam eva yāti iti
translated: Thinking of the divine, luminous, supreme Person, the Supreme Lord, O son of Prtha, one goes to Him alone.

original: madhusūdanaḥ tad evaṃ saptānām api praśnānām uttaram uktvā prayāṇakāle bhagavadanusmaraṇasya bhagavatprāptilakṣaṇaṃ phalaṃ vivarītum
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ tat evam saptānām api praśnānām uttaram uktvā prayāṇa kāle bhagavat anusmaraṇasya bhagavat prāpti lakṣaṇam phalam vivarītum
translated: Madhusudana: Having thus answered all the seven questions, in order to explain the result in the form of attaining the Lord of the remembrance of the Lord at the time of departure,

original: ārabhate abhyāseti /
analyzed: ārabhate abhyāsa iti
translated: he begins with abhyasa (practice).

original: abhyāsaḥ sajātīyapratyayapravāho mayi vijātīyapratyayānantaritaḥ ṣaṣṭhe prāg vyākhyātaḥ /
analyzed: abhyāsaḥ sajātīya pratyaya pravāhaḥ mayi vijātīya pratyaya anantaritaḥ ṣaṣṭhe prāk vyākhyātaḥ
translated: Practice is the uninterrupted flow of homogeneous cognitions in Me, as explained earlier in the sixth chapter.

original: sa eva yogaḥ samādhis tena yuktaṃ tatraiva vyāpṛtam ātmākāravṛttiśūnyaṃ yac cetas
analyzed: saḥ eva yogaḥ samādhiḥ tena yuktam tatra eva vyāpṛtam ātma ākāra vṛtti śūnyam yat cetas
translated: That itself is yoga, concentration. The mind that is united with that, engaged in that alone, devoid of modifications in the form of the self,

original: tena cetasābhyāsapāṭavena nānyagāminā nānyatra viṣayāntare nirodhaprayatnaṃ vināpi
analyzed: tena cetasā abhyāsa pāṭavena na anya gāminā na anyatra viṣaya antare nirodha prayatnam vinā api
translated: by that mind, by the skillfulness of practice, which has the habit of not going to anything else, not going to any other object without the effort of cessation,

original: gantuṃ śīlam asyeti tena paramaṃ niratiśayaṃ puruṣaṃ pūrṇaṃ divyaṃ divi dyotanātmany
analyzed: gantum śīlam asya iti tena paramam niratiśayam puruṣam pūrṇam divyam divi dyotana ātmani
translated: one goes to the supreme, unsurpassed, complete, divine Person, the Self of light in heaven,

original: āditye bhavaṃ yaś cāsāv āditye iti śruteḥ /
analyzed: āditye bhavam yaḥ ca asau āditye iti śruteḥ
translated: And that which is born of the Sun is called 'Aditya' according to the Vedic text.

original: yāti gacchati /
analyzed: yāti gacchati
translated: Yaati, goes;

original: he pārtha /
analyzed: he pārtha
translated: O son of Prtha.

original: anucintayan śāstrācāryopadeśam anudhyāyan ////
analyzed: anucintayan śāstra ācārya upadeśam anudhyāyan
translated: Anucintayan, thinking of, reflecting upon, the instructions of the scriptures and the teacher.

original: viśvanāthaḥ tasmāt smaraṇābhyāsina evāntakāle svata eva matsmaraṇaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: bhavati
translated: Visvanatha: Therefore, only those who are habituated to remembrance will naturally remember Me at the time of death.

original: tena ca māṃ prāpnotīty ataś cetaso matsmaraṇam eva paramo yoga ity āha abhyāsayoga iti /
analyzed: tena ca mām prāpnoti iti atas cetasaḥ mad smaraṇam eva paramaḥ yogaḥ iti āha abhyāsa yogaḥ iti
translated: And by that, they attain Me. Thus, the supreme yoga is only the remembrance of Me in the mind. Therefore, He says, 'Abhyasa-yogena' (by the yoga of practice).

original: abhyāso matsmaraṇasya punaḥ punar āvṛttir eva yogas tadyuktena cetasā /
analyzed: abhyāsaḥ mad smaraṇasya punar punar āvṛttiḥ eva yogaḥ tad yuktena cetasā
translated: Abhyasa (practice) is the repetition again and again of the remembrance of Me. Yoga is that with which the mind is endowed.

original: ataeva nānyaṃ viṣayaṃ gantuṃ śīlaṃ yasya tena /
analyzed: ataeva na anyam viṣayam gantum śīlam yasya tena
translated: And for that very reason, one who has the habit of not going to any other object.

original: smaraṇābhyāsena cittasya svabhāvavijayo 'pi bhavatīti bhāvaḥ ////
analyzed: smaraṇa abhyāsena cittasya svabhāva vijayaḥ pi bhavati iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And by the practice of remembrance, there is also the conquest of the natural tendency of the mind. This is the idea.

original: baladevaḥ sārvadikī smṛtir evāntimasmṛtikarīty evaṃ draḍhayati abhyāsenti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ sārvadikī smṛtiḥ eva antima smṛti karī iti evam draḍhayati
translated: Baladeva: In order to strengthen the idea that only continuous remembrance brings about the final remembrance, He says, 'Abhyasa-yogena' (by the yoga of practice).

original: abhyāsaḥ smaraṇāvṛttir eva yogas tadyuktenātaevānanyagāminā /
analyzed: abhyāsaḥ smaraṇa āvṛttiḥ eva yogaḥ tad yuktena ataeva ananyagāminā
translated: Abhyasa (practice) is the repetition of remembrance itself. Yoga is that with which the mind is endowed. And for that very reason, it does not go to any other object.

original: tato 'nyatrācalatā tad ekāgreṇa cetasā divyaṃ puruṣaṃ paramaṃ saśrīkaṃ nārāyaṇaṃ vāsudevam anucintayan tam eva kīṭabhṛṅganyāyena tattulāḥ
analyzed: tatas nyatra acalatā tat ekāgreṇa cetasā divyam puruṣam paramam sa śrīkam nārāyaṇam vāsudevam anucintayan tam eva kīṭa bhṛṅga nyāyena tad tulāḥ
translated: Then, going elsewhere, he attains that supreme divine person, Nārāyaṇa Vāsudeva, along with his glory, by contemplating him with a one-pointed mind, and becomes like him in qualities, like an insect becoming like a bee.

original: san yāti labhate ////
analyzed: san yāti labhate
translated: He attains that state.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: kaviṃ purāṇam anuśāsitāram🔽aṇor aṇīyāṃsam anusmared yaḥ /🔽sarvasya dhātāram acintyarūpam
analyzed: kavim purāṇam anuśāsitāram  aṇoḥ aṇīyāṃsam anusmaret yaḥ  sarvasya dhātāram acintya rūpam
translated: One who remembers that ancient, all-knowing, all-pervading,🔽subtler than the subtle, supporter of all, inconceivable,

original: ādityavarṇaṃ tamasaḥ parastāt ////
analyzed: āditya varṇam tamasaḥ parastāt
translated: sun-hued, beyond darkness,

original: śrīdharaḥ punar apy anucintanīyaṃ puruṣaṃ viśinaṣṭi kavim iti dvābhyām /
translated: Śrīdhara again describes the person to be contemplated with two verses beginning with the wise.

original: kaviṃ sarvajñaṃ sarvavidyānirmātāraṃ purāṇaṃ manādisiddham /
analyzed: kavim sarvajñam sarva vidyā nirmātāram purāṇam man ādi siddham
translated: The wise one is omniscient, the creator of all knowledge, ancient, existing from the beginning of creation.

original: anuśāsitāraṃ niyantāram /
analyzed: anuśāsitāram niyantāram
translated: The all-pervading one is the controller.

original: aṇoḥ sūkṣmād apy aṇīyāṃsaṃ atisūkṣmam ākāśakāladigbhyo 'py atisūkṣmataram /
analyzed: aṇoḥ sūkṣmāt api aṇīyāṃsam ati sūkṣmam ākāśa kāla digbhyaḥ pi ati sūkṣmataram
translated: Subtler than the subtle means more subtle than even the most subtle, more subtle than even space, time and directions.

original: sarvasya dhātāraṃ poṣakam /
analyzed: sarvasya dhātāram poṣakam
translated: The supporter of all is the nourisher.

original: aparimitamahimatvād acintyarūpaṃ malīmasayor manobuddhyor agocaram /
analyzed: aparimita mahima tvāt acintya rūpam malīmasayoḥ manaḥ buddhyoḥ agocaram
translated: Inconceivable form means beyond the reach of the defiled mind and intellect due to having immeasurable greatness.

original: vedāham etaṃ puruṣaṃ mahāntam ādityavarṇaṃ tamasaḥ parastāt iti śruteḥ ////
analyzed: veda aham etam puruṣam mahāntam āditya varṇam tamasaḥ parastāt iti śruteḥ
translated: I know this great person, sun-hued, beyond darkness - according to the Vedic text.

original: madhusūdanaḥ punar api tam evānucintayitavyaṃ gantavyaṃ ca puruṣaṃ viśinaṣṭi kavim iti /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ punar api tam eva anucintayitavyam gantavyam ca puruṣam viśinaṣṭi kavim iti
translated: Madhusudana again describes that very person who is to be thought of and gone to, with the word 'kavi'.

original: kaviṃ krāntadarśinaṃ tenātītānāgatādyaśeṣavastudarśitvena sarvajñam /
analyzed: kavim krānta darśinam tena atīta an āgata ādi aśeṣa vastu darśi tvena sarvajñam
translated: Kavi, one who has transcendent vision, is omniscient by virtue of seeing all things past, future, etc.

original: purāṇaṃ cirantanaṃ sarvakāraṇatvād anādim iti yāvat /
analyzed: purāṇam cirantanam sarva kāraṇa tvāt anādim iti yāvat
translated: And purana, ancient, is beginningless, since it is the cause of all, i.e. it is eternal.

original: anuśāsitāraṃ sarvasya jagato niyantāram /
analyzed: anuśāsitāram sarvasya jagataḥ niyantāram
translated: Anusashitara, the controller, is the ruler of the entire world.

original: aṇor aṇīyāṃsaṃ sūkṣād apy ākāśādeḥ sūkṣmataraṃ tadupādānatvāt /
analyzed: aṇoḥ aṇīyāṃsam sūkṣāt api ākāśa ādeḥ sūkṣmataram tad upādāna tvāt
translated: Anor aniyamsam, subtler than the subtle, subtler than even space, etc., because it is the material cause of all.

original: sarvasya karmaphalajātasya dhātāraṃ vicitratayā prāṇibhyo vibhaktāraṃ phalam ata upapatteḥ iti nyāyāt /
analyzed: sarvasya karma phala jātasya dhātāram vicitra tayā prāṇibhyaḥ vibhaktāram phalam atas upapatteḥ iti nyāyāt
translated: Dhataram, the ordainer, the one who distributes the various results to the creatures by the law of 'the result in accordance with the nature of the action'.

original: na cintayituṃ śakyam aparimitam ahimatvena rūpaṃ yasya tam /
analyzed: na cintayitum śakyam aparimitam ahima tvena rūpam yasya tam
translated: And acintyavarnam, of inconceivable form, whose form cannot be thought of because it is immeasurable.

original: ādityasyeva sakalajagadavabhāsako varṇaḥ prakāśo yasya taṃ sarvasya jagato 'vabhāsakam iti yāvat /
analyzed: ādityasya iva sakala jagat avabhāsakaḥ varṇaḥ prakāśaḥ yasya tam sarvasya jagataḥ vabhāsakam iti yāvat
translated: Varna, color, is the light that illuminates the entire world, like the sun. He is that which illuminates the entire world.

original: ataeva tamasaḥ parastāt tamaso mohāndhakārād ajñānalakṣaṇāt parastāt prakāśarūpatvena tamovirodhinam iti yāvat /
analyzed: ataeva tamasaḥ parastāt tamasaḥ moha andhakārāt ajñāna lakṣaṇāt parastāt prakāśa rūpa tvena tamaḥ virodhinam iti yāvat
translated: And tamasaḥ parastāt, beyond darkness, beyond the darkness of delusion, beyond ignorance, which is of the nature of light, i.e. which is opposed to darkness.

original: anusmarec cintayed yaḥ kaścid api sa taṃ yātīti pūrveṇaiva🔽sambandhaḥ /
analyzed: anusmaret cintayet yaḥ kaścid api sa tam yāti iti pūrveṇa eva  sambandhaḥ
translated: And whoever remembers and thinks of Him, he goes to Him. This is the connection with the previous verse.

original: sa taṃ paraṃ puruṣam upaiti divyam iti pareṇa vā sambandhaḥ ////
analyzed: sa tam param puruṣam upaiti divyam iti pareṇa vā sambandhaḥ
translated: Or this is connected with the next verse, He attains that Supreme Person, the Divine One.

original: viśvanāthaḥ yogābhyāsaṃ vinā manaso viṣayagrāmān nivṛttir durghaṭā /
translated: Visvanatha: Without the practice of yoga, it is difficult to turn the mind away from the group of sense objects.

original: yac ca vinā sātatyena bhagavatsmaraṇam api durghaṭam iti yuktam /
analyzed: yat ca vinā sātatyena bhagavat smaraṇam api durghaṭam iti yuktam
translated: And without continuous remembrance of the Lord, it is also difficult. So it is proper.

original: kenacit yogābhyāsena sahitaiva bhaktiḥ kriyata iti tāṃ yogamiśrāṃ bhaktim āha kavim iti pañcabhiḥ /
analyzed: kenacid yoga abhyāsena sahitā eva bhaktiḥ kriyate iti tām yoga miśrām bhaktim āha kavim iti pañcabhiḥ
translated: With some practice of yoga, devotion is performed. He speaks of that devotion mixed with yoga with five verses beginning with the wise one.

original: kaviṃ sarvajñaṃ sarvajño 'py anyaḥ sanakādiḥ sārvakāliko na bhavaty ata āha purāṇam anādiṃ sarvajño 'nādir apy antaryāmī sa bhaktyupadeṣṭā
analyzed: kavim sarvajñam sarvajñaḥ u pi anyaḥ sanaka ādiḥ sārvakālikaḥ na bhavati atas āha purāṇam anādim sarvajñaḥ na ādiḥ api antaryāmī sa bhakti upadeṣṭā  /
translated: The wise one is omniscient. But another omniscient person like Sanaka and others is not all-pervading. Therefore he says ancient, beginningless. The all-pervading one is beginningless, but he is not the teacher of devotion.

original: na bhavaty ata āha anuśāsitāram /
analyzed: na bhavati atas āha anuśāsitāram
translated: Therefore he says the instructor.

original: kṛpayā svabhaktiśikṣakaṃ kṛṣṇarāmādisvarūpam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: kṛpayā sva bhakti śikṣakam kṛṣṇa rāma ādi svarūpam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: the form of Krishna, Rama, etc., who teaches devotion to his devotees out of compassion.

original: tādṛśakṛpālur api sudurvijñeyatattva eva ity āha aṇoḥ sakāśād apy aṇīyāṃsam /
analyzed: tādṛśa kṛpāluḥ api su durvijñeya tattvaḥ eva iti āha aṇoḥ sakāśāt api aṇīyāṃsam
translated: Such a compassionate one is indeed of very difficult to understand truth. Therefore he says smaller than the smallest.

original: tarhi sa kiṃ jīva iva paramāṇupramāṇas tatrāha sarvasya dhātāraṃ sarvavastumātradhārakatvena sarvavyāpakatvāt paraṃ mahāparimāṇam apīty
analyzed: tarhi sa kim jīvaḥ iva paramāṇu pramāṇaḥ tatra āha sarvasya dhātāram sarva vastu mātra dhāraka tvena sarva vyāpaka tvāt param mahā parimāṇam api iti
translated: Then, is He of the size of an atom like a living being? He says that He is the supporter of all, pervading everything by supporting all things, and is supreme, of great size.

original: arthaḥ /
analyzed: arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

original: ataevācintyarūpam /
analyzed: ataeva acintya rūpam
translated: And for this very reason, His form is inconceivable.

original: puruṣavidhatvena🔽madhyamaparimāṇam api tasyānanyaprakāśyatvam āha ādityavarṇam ādityavat svaparaprakāśako varṇaḥ svarūpaṃ yasya /
analyzed: puruṣavidha tvena  madhyama parimāṇam api tasya ananya prakāśya tvam āha āditya varṇam āditya vat sva para prakāśakaḥ varṇaḥ svarūpam yasya
translated: Though of the size of a man,🔽He is not manifested by anything else. He says that His color is like the sun, that is, He has a form like the sun, which illuminates both itself and others.

original: tathā tamasaḥ prakṛteḥ parastāt vartamānaṃ māyāśaktimantam api māyātītasvarūpam ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: tathā tamasaḥ prakṛteḥ parastāt vartamānam māyā śaktimantam api māyā atīta svarūpam iti arthaḥ
translated: Thus, He is beyond the darkness of primordial material nature, existing beyond it. He is the possessor of the power of illusion, but His nature is beyond illusion. This is the meaning.

original: baladevaḥ yogād ṛte cetaso 'nanyagāmitā duṣkareti yogamiśrāṃ bhaktim āha kavim ity ādibhiḥ pañcabhiḥ /
analyzed: baladevaḥ yogāt ṛte cetasaḥ duṣkarā iti yoga miśrām bhaktim āha kavim iti ādibhiḥ pañcabhiḥ
translated: Balarama says that without yoga, the mind cannot be made to go to anything else, so it is difficult. Therefore, he speaks of devotion mixed with yoga with five verses beginning with The wise one.

original: kaviṃ sarvajñaṃ /
analyzed: kavim sarvajñam
translated: The wise one is omniscient.

original: anuśāsitāram raghunāthādirūpeṇa hitopadeṣṭāram /
analyzed: anuśāsitāram raghunātha ādi rūpeṇa hita upadeṣṭāram
translated: The instructor is the one who teaches what is beneficial in the form of Raghunatha and others.

original: aṇor aṇīyāṃsaṃ tena cāṇum api jīvam antaḥ praviśatīti siddham /
analyzed: aṇoḥ aṇīyāṃsam tena ca aṇum api jīvam antar praviśati iti siddham
translated: He is smaller than the smallest, so it is established that He enters even an atom-sized living being.

original: āha caivaṃ śrutiḥ antaḥ praviṣṭaḥ śāstā janānām iti /
analyzed: āha ca evam śrutiḥ antar praviṣṭaḥ śāstā janānām iti
translated: And the shruti says thus: The chastiser has entered within the people.

original: aṇīyaso 'pi tasya vyāptim āha sarvasyeti /
analyzed: aṇīyasaḥ api tasya vyāptim āha sarvasya iti
translated: He says that it pervades even the smallest with 'of all'.

original: kṛtsnasya jagato dhātāraṃ dhārakam /
analyzed: kṛtsnasya jagataḥ dhātāram dhārakam
translated: The supporter of the entire universe.

original: nanu katham evaṃ saṅgacchate tatrāha acintyarūpaṃ avitarkyasvarūpaṃ ekam eva brahma puruṣavidhatvena madhyamaparimāṇam aṇor aṇīyāṃsam ity
analyzed: nanu katham evam saṅgacchate tatra āha acintya rūpam a vitarkya svarūpam ekam eva brahma puruṣavidha tvena madhyama parimāṇam aṇoḥ aṇīyāṃsam iti
translated: But how can this be understood? He says that Brahman, which is of inconceivable form, of unthinkable nature, is the one, of the size of a man, smaller than the smallest,

original: ukteḥ /
analyzed: ukteḥ
translated: as stated in the Upanishad.

original: paramāṇuparimāṇaṃ sarvasya dhātāram ity ukteḥ /
analyzed: paramāṇu parimāṇam sarvasya dhātāram iti ukteḥ
translated: And the supporter of the size of an atom of all, as stated.

original: paraṃ mahāparimāṇaṃ ceti /
analyzed: param mahā parimāṇam ca iti
translated: And of the highest, of great size.

original: nātra yukter avakāśaḥ /
analyzed: na atra yukteḥ avakāśaḥ
translated: There is no scope for reasoning here.

original: svaparakāśatām āha ādityeti sūryavat svaparaprakāśakam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: sva parakāśa tām āha āditya iti sūrya vat sva para prakāśakam iti arthaḥ
translated: He says that it is the illuminator of itself and others with 'like the sun'. The meaning is that it illuminates itself and others like the sun.

original: māyāgandhāsparśam āha tamasa iti /
analyzed: māyā gandha asparśam āha tamasaḥ iti
translated: He says that it has the touch of the fragrance of Maya with 'beyond darkness'.

original: tamaso māyāyāḥ parastāt sthitaṃ /
analyzed: tamasaḥ māyāyāḥ parastāt sthitam
translated: It exists beyond the darkness, the Maya.

original: māyinam api māyātītam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: māyinam api māyā atītam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is beyond Maya, even though it is the possessor of Maya.

original: etādṛśaṃ puruṣaṃ yo 'nukṣaṇaṃ smaret sa taṃ paraṃ puruṣam upaiti iti pareṇānvayaḥ ////
analyzed: etādṛśam puruṣam yaḥ nu kṣaṇam smaret sa tam param puruṣam upaiti iti pareṇa anvayaḥ
translated: The one who constantly remembers such a Purusha, he attains that Supreme Purusha. The connection with the next verse is thus.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: prayāṇakāle manasācalena
analyzed: prayāṇa kāle manasā acalena
translated: At the time of departure, with an unwavering mind,

original: bhaktyā yukto yogabalena caiva /
analyzed: bhaktyā yuktaḥ yoga balena ca eva
translated: united with devotion and the power of yoga,

original: bhruvor madhye prāṇam āveśya samyak
analyzed: bhruvoḥ madhye prāṇam āveśya samyak
translated: having properly directed the life force between the eyebrows,

original: sa taṃ paraṃ puruṣam upaiti divyam ////
analyzed: sa tam param puruṣam upaiti divyam
translated: He attains that divine Supreme Person.

original: śrīdharaḥ prayāṇakāla iti /
translated: Śrīdhara: At the time of death.

original: saprapañcaprakṛtiṃ bhittvā yas tiṣṭhāti /
analyzed: sa prapañca prakṛtim bhittvā yaḥ tiṣṭhāti
translated: He who abides after breaking through prakṛti along with its modifications.

original: evaṃbhūtaṃ puruṣam antakāle bhaktiyukto niścalena vikṣeparahitena manasā yo 'nusmaret /
analyzed: evaṃbhūtam puruṣam antakāle bhakti yuktaḥ niścalena vikṣepa rahitena manasā yaḥ nusmaret
translated: One who, at the time of death, recollects with a mind that is steady, free from distraction, and endowed with devotion, that Person who is of such a nature.

original: manonaiścalye hetuḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ naiścalye hetuḥ
translated: The cause of steadiness of mind is:

original: yogabalena samyak suṣumṇā mārgeṇa bhruvor madhye prāṇam āveśyeti /
analyzed: yoga balena samyak suṣumṇā mārgeṇa bhruvoḥ madhye prāṇam āveśya iti
translated: By the power of yoga, having withdrawn the vital breath into the middle of the eyebrows through the suṣumnā channel.

original: sa taṃ paraṃ puruṣaṃ paramātmasvarūpaṃ divyaṃ dyotanātmakaṃ prāpnoti ////
analyzed: sa tam param puruṣam paramātma svarūpam divyam dyotana ātmakam prāpnoti
translated: He attains that divine Supreme Person, who is of the nature of the Supreme Self, who is luminous.

original: madhusūdanaḥ kadā tadanusmaraṇe pratrātireko 'bhyavartate tad āha prayāneti /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ kadā tad anusmaraṇe pratra atirekaḥ bhyavartate tat āha prayāna iti
translated: Madhusūdana: When does the excess of that recollection occur? That is said by at the time of departure, etc.

original: prayāṇakāle 'ntakāle 'calenaikāgreṇa manasā taṃ puruṣaṃ yo 'nusmared ity anuvartate /
analyzed: prayāṇa kāle nta kāle calena ekāgreṇa manasā tam puruṣam yaḥ nusmaret iti anuvartate
translated: At the time of death, at the time of departure, one who recollects that Person with a steady, single-pointed mind - this is continued.

original: kīdṛśaḥ bhaktyā parameśvaraviṣayeṇa parameṇa premṇā yuktaḥ /
analyzed: kīdṛśaḥ bhaktyā parameśvara viṣayeṇa parameṇa premṇā yuktaḥ
translated: What kind of person? One who is endowed with the highest love, which is devotion to the Supreme Lord.

original: yogasya samādher balena tajjanitasaṃskārasamūhena vyutthānasaṃskāravirodhinā ca yuktaḥ /
analyzed: yogasya samādheḥ balena tad janita saṃskāra samūhena vyutthāna saṃskāra virodhinā ca yuktaḥ
translated: And one who is endowed with the power of yoga, the collection of impressions generated by that [devotion], and with that which is opposed to the impressions of the waking state.

original: evaṃ prathamaṃ hṛdayapuṇḍarīke vaśīkṛtya tata ūrdhvagāminyā suṣumṇayā nāḍyā gurūpadiṣṭamārgeṇa
analyzed: evam prathamam hṛdaya puṇḍarīke vaśīkṛtya tatas ūrdhva gāminyā suṣumṇayā nāḍyā guru upadiṣṭa mārgeṇa
translated: Having thus first controlled the mind in the lotus of the heart, then by the upward-moving Suṣumnā nerve, by the path taught by the Guru,

original: bhūmijayakrameṇa bhruvor madhye ājñācakre prāṇam āveśya sthāpayitvā samyag apramatto🔽brahmarandhrād utkrāmya sa evam upāsakas taṃ kaviṃ purāṇam anuśāsitāram ityādilakṣaṇaṃ
analyzed: bhūmi jaya krameṇa bhruvoḥ madhye ājñācakre prāṇam āveśya sthāpayitvā samyak apramattaḥ  brahmarandhrāt utkrāmya saḥ evam upāsakaḥ tam kavim purāṇam anuśāsitāram ityādi lakṣaṇam
translated: by the process of conquering the psychic centers, having placed the vital energy in the Ājñā cakra between the eyebrows, having established it, being fully attentive,

original: paraṃ puruṣaṃ divyaṃ dyotanātmakam upaiti pratipadyate // //
analyzed: param puruṣam divyam dyotana ātmakam upaiti pratipadyate
translated: having emerged from the aperture of Brahmā, that lay follower thus approaches, attains, that Supreme Person, who is divine, of the nature of light, who has the characteristics described as the wise, the ancient, the ruler, etc.

original: viśvanāthaḥ prayāṇakāle 'ntakāle 'calena niścalena manasā yā satatasmaraṇamayī bhaktis tayā yuktaḥ /
translated: Viṣṇu: Endowed with devotion consisting of constant remembrance, with an unwavering mind, at the time of death, at the time of departure.

original: kathaṃ manaso naiścalyam /
analyzed: katham manasaḥ naiścalyam
translated: How is there steadiness of mind?

original: ata āha yogasya yogābhyāsasya balena /
analyzed: atas āha yogasya yoga abhyāsasya balena
translated: To explain this, he says: by the power of yoga, by the practice of yoga.

original: yogaprakāraṃ darśayati bhruvor madhye ājñācakre ////
analyzed: yoga prakāram darśayati bhruvoḥ madhye ājñācakre
translated: He shows the method of yoga: in the Ājñā cakra between the eyebrows.

original: baladevaḥ yo jano bhaktyā paramātmapremṇā yogabalena samādhijanitasaṃskāranicayena ca yuktaḥ prayāṇakāle maraṇasamaye 'calenaikāgreṇa
analyzed: baladevaḥ yaḥ janaḥ bhaktyā paramātma premṇā yoga balena samādhi janita saṃskāra nicayena ca yuktaḥ prayāṇa kāle maraṇa samaye calena ekāgreṇa  /
translated: Balarāma: That person who is endowed with devotion, with the love of the Supreme Self, with the power of yoga, and with the accumulation of impressions generated by meditation, at the time of departure, at the time of death, with an unwavering, single-pointed🔽mind,

original: manasā taṃ puruṣam anusmaret /
analyzed: manasā tam puruṣam anusmaret
translated: One should recollect that Supreme Person with the mind.

original: yogaprakāram āha bhruvor iti /
analyzed: yoga prakāram āha bhruvoḥ iti
translated: He says the way of yoga: in the middle of the eyebrows.

original: bhruvor madhye ājñācakre prāṇam āveśya saṃsthāpya samyak sāvadhānaḥ san sa taṃ puruṣam upaiti ////
analyzed: bhruvoḥ madhye ājñācakre prāṇam āveśya saṃsthāpya samyak sa avadhānaḥ san sa tam puruṣam upaiti
translated: Having placed, having established, the vital breath in the ajna cakra, in the middle of the eyebrows, being fully attentive, he approaches that Supreme Person.

original: BhG /🔽yad akṣaraṃ vedavido vadanti
analyzed: bhg  yat akṣaram veda vidaḥ vadanti
translated: BhG.🔽That imperishable thing which the knowers of the Vedas speak of,

original: viśanti yad yatayo vītarāgāḥ /
analyzed: viśanti yat yatayaḥ vīta rāgāḥ
translated: which the detached sages enter,

original: yad icchanto brahmacaryaṃ caranti
analyzed: yat icchantaḥ brahmacaryam caranti
translated: desiring which they lead the life of celibacy,

original: tat te padaṃ saṃgraheṇa pravakṣye ////
analyzed: tat te padam saṃgraheṇa pravakṣye
translated: I shall tell you that state in brief.

original: śrīdharaḥ kevalād abhyāsayogād api praṇavābhyāsam antaraṅgaṃ vidhitsuḥ pratijānīteyad akṣaram iti /
translated: Desiring to prescribe the repetition of the syllable Om as more essential than mere practice yoga, Sri Sridhara begins with the words That imperishable thing.

original: yad akṣaraṃ vedārthajñā vadanti /
analyzed: yat akṣaram veda artha jñāḥ vadanti
translated: That imperishable thing which the knowers of the meaning of the Vedas speak of.

original: etasya vā akṣarasya praśāsane gārgi sūryācandramasau vidhṛtau tiṣṭhata iti śruteḥ /
analyzed: etasya vai akṣarasya praśāsane gārgi sūryācandramasau vidhṛtau tiṣṭhataḥ iti śruteḥ
translated: In the administration of this imperishable thing, O Gargi, the sun and moon are held and stand, according to the Shruti.

original: vīto rāgo yebhyas te vītarāgāḥ /🔽yatayaḥ prayatnavanto yad viśanti /
analyzed: vītaḥ rāgaḥ yebhyaḥ te vīta rāgāḥ  yatayaḥ prayatnavantaḥ yat viśanti
translated: Those from whom attachment has departed are detached.🔽The sages, who are diligent, enter that.

original: yac ca jñātum icchanto gurukule brahmacaryaṃ caranti /
analyzed: yat ca jñātum icchantaḥ guru kule brahmacaryam caranti
translated: And those who desire to know lead the life of celibacy in the guru's house.

original: tat te tubhyaṃ padaṃ padyate gamyata iti padaṃ prāpyam /
analyzed: tat te tubhyam padam padyate gamyate iti padam prāpyam
translated: That state is told to you. It is called pada because it is to be reached.

original: saṅgraheṇa saṃkṣepeṇa pravakṣye /
analyzed: saṅgraheṇa saṃkṣepeṇa pravakṣye
translated: I shall expound in brief, in a concise manner.

original: tatprāptyupāyaṃ kathayiṣyāmīty arthaḥ ////
analyzed: tad prāpti upāyam kathayiṣyāmi iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: I shall describe the means of attaining that.

original: madhusūdanaḥ idānīṃ yena kenacid abhidhānena dhyānakāle bhagavadanusmaraṇe prāpte🔽sarve vedā yatpadamāmananti
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ idānīm yena kenacid abhidhānena dhyāna kāle bhagavat anusmaraṇe prāpte  sarve vedāḥ yat padam āmananti
translated: Madhusudana: Now, when the recollection of the Lord is to be done at the time of meditation by some name or other,🔽all the Vedas proclaim that one pada (word, step, position),

original: tapāṃsi sarvāṇi ca yadvadanti /
analyzed: tapāṃsi sarvāṇi ca yat vadanti
translated: all the austerities speak of that,

original: yadicchanto brahmacaryaṃ caranti
analyzed: yat icchantaḥ brahmacaryam caranti
translated: desiring which they lead the life of celibacy,

original: tatte padaṃ saṃgraheṇa bravīmy om ity etat // KaṭhaU / /
analyzed: tat te padam saṃgraheṇa bravīmi om iti etat kaṭhau
translated: I tell you that pada in brief: Om, that is it. (Katha Upanishad)

original: ity ādiśrutipratipāditatvena praṇavenaivābhidhānena tadanusmaraṇaṃ kartavyaṃ nānyena mantrādineti niyantum upakramate yad akṣaram iti /
analyzed: iti ādi śruti pratipādita tvena praṇavena eva abhidhānena tad anusmaraṇam kartavyam na anyena mantra ādinā iti niyantum upakramate yat akṣaram iti
translated: In order to restrict that recollection to be done only by the utterance of the Pranava (Om), which is taught by such Vedic texts as the above, and not by any other mantra etc., he begins with the verse yad aksaram (that which is imperishable).

original: yad akṣaram avināśi oṅkārākhyaṃ brahma vedavido vadanti etad vai tad akṣaraṃ gārgi
analyzed: yat akṣaram avināśi oṅkāra ākhyam brahma veda vidaḥ vadanti etat vai tat akṣaram gārgi
translated: That which is imperishable, the indestructible Brahman called Om, is spoken of by those who know the Vedas. This indeed is that imperishable, O Gargi,

original: brāhmaṇā abhivadanty asthūlam aṇv ahrasvam adīrgham ity ādivacanaiḥ sarvaviśeṣanivartanena pratipādayanti /
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ abhivadanti a sthūlam aṇu a hrasvam a dīrgham iti ādi vacanaiḥ sarva viśeṣa nivartanena pratipādayanti
translated: the Brahmanas proclaim it by such statements as not gross, not subtle, not short, not long etc., by negating all particulars.

original: pramāṇakuśalair eva pratipannaṃ kiṃ tu muktopasṛpyatayā tair apy anubhūtam ity āhaviśanti
analyzed: pramāṇa kuśalaiḥ eva pratipannam kim tu mukta upasṛpya tayā taiḥ api anubhūtam iti āha viśanti
translated: The wise have indeed realized it. But it has been experienced by them as if it were something to be attained by liberation. Therefore it is said:🔽The ascetics, those who are diligent, the renunciates, the passionless, the desireless, enter

original: svarūpatayā samyagdarśanena yad akṣaraṃ yatayo yatnaśīlāḥ saṃnyāsino vītarāgā niḥspṛhāḥ /
analyzed: sva rūpa tayā samyak darśanena yat akṣaram yatayaḥ yatna śīlāḥ saṃnyāsinaḥ vīta rāgāḥ niḥspṛhāḥ
translated: that imperishable reality in its own form by perfect knowledge.

original: na kevalaṃ siddhair anubhūtaṃ sādhakānām api sarvo 'pi prayāsas tadartha ity āha
analyzed: na kevalam siddhaiḥ anubhūtam sādhakānām api sarvaḥ api prayāsaḥ tad arthe iti āha
translated: Not only has it been experienced by the perfected, but all the effort of the aspirants is also for that. Therefore it is said:

original: yadicchanto jñātuṃ naiṣṭhikā brahmacāriṇo brahmacaryaṃ gurukulavāsāditapaś caranti
analyzed: yat icchantaḥ jñātum naiṣṭhikāḥ brahmacāriṇaḥ brahmacaryam guru kula vāsa ādi tapaḥ caranti
translated: Desiring to know that, the life-long celibates, the students, practice celibacy, living with the teacher, and austerities.

original: yāvajjīvaṃ tad akṣarākhyaṃ padaṃ padanīyaṃ te tubhyaṃ saṅgraheṇa saṅkṣepeṇāhaṃ
analyzed: yāvajjīvam tat akṣara ākhyam padam padanīyam te tubhyam saṅgraheṇa saṅkṣepeṇa aham
translated: For as long as life lasts, that state called the imperishable, they should be devoted to it. I will🔽declare it to you in brief, in summary.

original: pravakṣye prakarṣeṇa kathayiṣyāmi yathā tava bodho bhavati tathā /
analyzed: pravakṣye prakarṣeṇa kathayiṣyāmi yathā tava bodhaḥ bhavati tathā
translated: I will explain it in such a way that your understanding may arise.

original: atas tad akṣaraṃ kathaṃ mayā jñeyam ity ākulo mā bhūr ity abhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: atas tat akṣaram katham mayā jñeyam iti ākulaḥ mā bhūḥ iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: Therefore, do not be anxious, thinking How can that imperishable be known by me?

original: atra ca parasya brahmaṇo vācakarūpeṇa pratimāvatpratīkarūpeṇa ca yaḥ punar etaṃ
analyzed: atra ca parasya brahmaṇaḥ vācaka rūpeṇa pratimāvat pratīka rūpeṇa ca yaḥ punar etam
translated: And here, that which is the reflection, as it were, of the supreme Brahman in the form of speech, and also in the form of an image,

original: trimātreṇom ity aneaivākṣareṇa paraṃ puruṣam abhidhyāyīta sa tam adhigacchati ity
analyzed: tri mātreṇa ūm iti param puruṣam abhidhyāyīta sa tam adhigacchati iti
translated: By the three-syllabled Om, by that very syllable, one should meditate on the Supreme Person. He attains Him.

original: ādivacanair mandamadhyamabuddhīnāṃ kramamuktiphalakam upāsanam uktaṃ tad evehāpi
analyzed: ādi vacanaiḥ manda madhyama buddhīnām krama mukti phalakam upāsanam uktam tat eva iha api
translated: And so on. By these statements, meditation that results in gradual liberation is taught for those of slow and medium intelligence. That very thing is

original: vivakṣitaṃ bhagavatā /
analyzed: vivakṣitam bhagavatā
translated: intended here by the Lord.

original: ato yogadhāraṇāsahitam oṅkāropāsanaṃ tat phalaṃ svasvarūpaṃ tato 'punarāvṛttis tanmārgaś cety arthajātam ucyate yāvad adhyāyasamāpti
analyzed: atas yoga dhāraṇā sahitam oṅkāra upāsanam tat phalam sva svarūpam punarāvṛttiḥ tad mārgaḥ ca iti artha jātam ucyate yāvat adhyāya samāpti
translated: Therefore, meditation on Om along with yogic postures, its result, one's own nature, non-return from that, and the path to that - this collection of meanings is being stated until the end of the chapter.

original: viśvanāthaḥ nanu bhruvor madhye prāṇam āveśya ity etāvan mātroktyā yogo na jñāyate /
analyzed: na jñāyate
translated: Visvanatha: Now, by merely stating having placed the life force between the eyebrows, yoga is not known.

original: tasmāt tatra yoge prakāraḥ kaḥ /🔽kiṃ japyaṃ /
analyzed: tasmāt tatra yoge prakāraḥ kaḥ  kim japyam
translated: Therefore, what is the method in that yoga?🔽What is to be repeated?

original: kiṃ vā dhyeyam /
analyzed: kim vā dhyeyam
translated: What is to be meditated upon?

original: kiṃ vā prāpyam ity api saṅkṣepeṇa brūhīty apekṣāyām āha yad iti tribhiḥ /
analyzed: kim vā prāpyam iti api saṅkṣepeṇa brūhi iti apekṣāyām āha yat iti tribhiḥ
translated: What is to be attained? Please tell that also in brief. With this expectation, he says with three [verses] beginning with 'yat'.

original: yad evākṣaram om ity ekākṣaravācyaṃ brahma yatayo viśanti tat padaṃ padyate gamyata iti padaṃ prāpyam /
analyzed: yat eva akṣaram om iti ekākṣara vācyam brahma yatayaḥ viśanti tat padam padyate gamyate iti padam prāpyam
translated: That very syllable, which is expressed by the one-syllabled Om, is the Brahman that the ascetics enter. That is the 'pada' [step]. It is said that 'pada' is that which is to be reached.

original: samyaktayā gṛhayte 'neneti saṅgrahas tadupāyas tena saha pravakṣye śṛṇu ////
analyzed: samyak tayā gṛhayte nena iti saṅgrahaḥ tad upāyaḥ tena saha pravakṣye śṛṇu
translated: I shall declare that along with the means of attaining it. Listen.

original: baladevaḥ nanu bhruvor madhye prāṇam āveśyaitāvatā yogo nāvagamyate /
analyzed: baladevaḥ nanu bhruvoḥ madhye prāṇam āveśya etāvatā yogaḥ na avagamyate
translated: Balarama: But by fixing the life-force between the eyebrows, yoga is not understood to that extent.

original: tasmāt tasya prakāraṃ tatra japyaṃ prāpyaṃ brūhīty apekṣāyām āha yad akṣaram iti tribhiḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tasya prakāram tatra japyam prāpyam brūhi iti apekṣāyām āha yat akṣaram iti tribhiḥ
translated: Therefore, when there is expectation of Please tell me the method of that, the meditation to be done there, and the goal to be attained, he says with three [verses] beginning with That imperishable...

original: ekam eva brahma akṣaram om iti vācakaṃ vadanti /
analyzed: ekam eva brahma akṣaram om iti vācakam vadanti
translated: They say that the one Brahman is the imperishable, or the syllable Om, which expresses it.

original: vītarāgā vinaṣṭāvidyā yatayo yad brahma tadvācyabhūtaṃ vijñānaikarasaṃ viśanti prāpnuvanti /
analyzed: vīta rāgāḥ vinaṣṭa avidyāḥ yatayaḥ yat brahma tad vācya bhūtam vijñāna eka rasam viśanti prāpnuvanti
translated: The ascetics, free from attachment, whose ignorance has perished, enter into that Brahman, which has become the object of expression, which is of the nature of pure knowledge.

original: tadubhayarpaṃ brahma jñātum icchanto naiṣṭhikā gurukulavasādilakṣaṇaṃ brahmacaryaṃ caranti /
analyzed: tad ubhaya ṛpam brahma jñātum icchantaḥ naiṣṭhikāḥ guru kula vasā ādi lakṣaṇam brahmacaryam caranti
translated: Desiring to know that Brahman, which is the support of both, the steadfast ones practice celibacy, characterized by living in the teacher's house and so on.

original: tat padaṃ prāpyaṃ saṅgraheṇopāyena saha pravakṣye vakṣyāmi yathānāyasena tvaṃ tadvidyāṃ prāpnuyāḥ /
analyzed: tat padam prāpyam saṅgraheṇa upāyena saha pravakṣye vakṣyāmi yathā an āyasena tvam tad vidyām prāpnuyāḥ
translated: I shall declare that goal to be attained along with the means of attaining it in brief, so that you may attain that knowledge without difficulty.

original: samyag gṛhyate tattvam anena iti nirukteḥ saṅgraha upāyaḥ ////
analyzed: samyak gṛhyate tattvam anena iti nirukteḥ saṅgrahaḥ upāyaḥ
translated: By the etymological explanation the truth is well grasped by this, the means is called sangraha (summary).

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: sarvadvārāṇi saṃyamya mano hṛdi nirudhya ca /
analyzed: sarva dvārāṇi saṃyamya manaḥ hṛdi nirudhya ca
translated: Having restrained all the sense-doors and having stopped the mind in the heart,

original: mūrdhny ādhāyātmanaḥ prāṇam āsthito yogadhāraṇām ////
analyzed: mūrdhni ādhāya ātmanaḥ prāṇam āsthitaḥ yoga dhāraṇām
translated: Placing his vital breath on the head, and resorting to the steadiness of yogic concentration.

original: om ity ekākṣaraṃ brahma vyāharan mām anusmaran /
analyzed: om iti ekākṣaram brahma vyāharan mām anusmaran
translated: Reciting the one-syllabled Brahman Om, and remembering Me,

original: yaḥ prayāti tyajan dehaṃ sa yāti paramāṃ gatim ////
analyzed: yaḥ prayāti tyajan deham sa yāti paramām gatim
translated: he who departs, abandoning the body, he attains the supreme goal.

original: śrīdharaḥ pratijñātam upāyaṃ sāṅgam āha dvābhyāṃ sarveti /
analyzed: āha
translated: Shridhar explains the promised means along with its auxiliaries in two verses, beginning with sarva.

original: sarvāṇi indriyadvārāṇi saṃyamya pratyāhṛtya /
analyzed: sarvāṇi indriya dvārāṇi saṃyamya pratyāhṛtya
translated: Having restrained all the doors of the senses, having withdrawn them.

original: cakṣurādibhiḥ bāhyaviṣayagrahaṇaṃ akurvan ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ ādibhiḥ bāhya viṣaya grahaṇam akurvan iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that he does not engage in grasping external objects with the eyes and so on.

original: manaś ca hṛdi nirudhya /
analyzed: manaḥ ca hṛdi nirudhya
translated: And having withdrawn the mind in the heart.

original: bāhyaviṣayasmaraṇam akurvan ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: bāhya viṣaya smaraṇam akurvan iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that he does not engage in recollecting external objects.

original: mūrdhni bhruvor madhye prāṇam ādhāya yogasya dhāraṇāṃ sthairyam āsthitaḥ āśritavān san ////
analyzed: mūrdhni bhruvoḥ madhye prāṇam ādhāya yogasya dhāraṇām sthairyam āsthitaḥ āśritavān san
translated: Having placed the vital breath in the middle of the eyebrows on the head, he has resorted to, has relied upon, the steadiness, the firmness, of yoga.

original: om iti / om ity ekaṃ yad akṣaraṃ tad eva brahmavācakatvād vā pratimādivad brahmapratīkatvād vā brahma /
analyzed: om iti om iti ekam yat akṣaram tat eva brahma vācaka tvāt vā pratimā ādi vat brahma pratīka tvāt vā brahma
translated: Om. The one-syllabled Om is Brahman itself, because it denotes Brahman, or because it is the symbol of Brahman like an image and so on.

original: tadvyāharan uccārayaṃs tadvācyaṃ ca mām anusmarann eva dehaṃ tyajan yaḥ prakarṣeṇa yāti arcirādimārgeṇa sa paramāṃ śreṣṭhāṃ gatiṃ madgatiṃ
analyzed: tat vyāharan uccārayan tad vācyam ca mām anusmaran eva deham tyajan yaḥ prakarṣeṇa yāti arciḥ ādi mārgeṇa sa paramām śreṣṭhām gatim mad gatim
translated: He who, uttering that, i.e. reciting it, and remembering Me, the object of that, even while giving up the body, goes by the path of light etc. in an excellent way, he goes to the highest, the best, goal, My goal.

original: yāti prāpnoti ////
analyzed: yāti prāpnoti
translated: He goes, he attains.

original: madhusūdanaḥ tatra pravakṣya iti pratijñātam arthaṃ sopakaraṇam āhaa dvābhyām sarvadvārāṇīti /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ tatra pravakṣye iti pratijñātam artham sa upakaraṇam āha dvābhyām sarva dvārāṇi iti
translated: Madhusudana: There, having promised to speak about the meaning along with the means in two verses beginning with by controlling all the doors,

original: sarvāṇīndriyadvārāṇi saṃyamya svasvaviṣayebhyaḥ pratyāhṛtya viṣayadoṣadarśanābhyāsāt tadvimukhatām āpāditaiḥ śrotrādibhiḥ śabdādiviṣayagrahaṇam
analyzed: sarvāṇi indriya dvārāṇi saṃyamya sva sva viṣayebhyaḥ pratyāhṛtya viṣaya doṣa darśana abhyāsāt tad vimukha tām āpāditaiḥ śrotra ādibhiḥ śabda ādi viṣaya grahaṇam
translated: he says: Having controlled all the doors of the senses, having withdrawn them from their respective objects, having made the ears etc. averse to them by practicing seeing the faults of the objects, he does not engage the ears etc. in grasping sound etc.

original: akurvan /
analyzed: akurvan
translated: Not engaging the external senses, he does not engage the internal sense either.

original: bāheyndriyanirodhe 'pi manasaḥ pracāraḥ syād ity ata āha mano hṛdi nirudhya ca /
analyzed: manasaḥ pracāraḥ syāt iti atas āha manaḥ hṛdi nirudhya ca
translated: Even when the external senses are restrained, the mind may still function, so he says: and restraining the mind in the heart.

original: abhyāsavairāgyābhyāṃ ṣaṣṭhe vyākhyātābhyāṃ hṛdayadeśe mano nirudhya nirvṛttikatām āpādya ca /
analyzed: abhyāsa vairāgyābhyām ṣaṣṭhe vyākhyātābhyām hṛdaya deśe manaḥ nirudhya nirvṛttika tām āpādya ca
translated: By practice and non-attachment, as explained in the sixth chapter, having restrained the mind in the region of the heart, having made it free from activity,

original: antar api viṣayacintām akurvann ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: antar api viṣaya cintām akurvan iti arthaḥ
translated: he does not think of objects even internally. This is the meaning.

original: evaṃ bahir antar upalabdhidvārāṇi sarvāṇi saṃnirudhya kriyādvāraṃ prāṇam api sarvato
analyzed: evam bahis antar upalabdhi dvārāṇi sarvāṇi saṃnirudhya kriyā dvāram prāṇam api sarvatas
translated: Thus, having closed all the doors of perception externally and internally, and having restrained the breath, the door of action, from all sides,

original: nigṛhya bhūmijayakrameṇa mūrdhny ādhāya bhruvor madhye tadupari ca gurūpadiṣṭamārgeṇāveśyātmano
analyzed: nigṛhya bhūmi jaya krameṇa mūrdhni ādhāya bhruvoḥ madhye tad upari ca guru upadiṣṭa mārgeṇa āveśya ātmanaḥ
translated: placing it on the head in the order of conquering the stages of the earth, and having caused it to enter between the eyebrows, on that, along the path taught by the Guru,

original: yogadhāraṇām ātmaviṣayasamādhirūpāṃ dhāraṇām
analyzed: yoga dhāraṇām ātma viṣaya samādhi rūpām dhāraṇām
translated: having resorted to the yoga-dhāraṇā, the dhāraṇā in the form of concentration on the self as the object,

original: āsthitaḥ / ātmana iti devatādivyavṛttyartham ////
analyzed: āsthitaḥ ātmanaḥ iti devatā divya vṛtti artham
translated: the word 'self' is used to exclude deities and others.

original: om ity ekam akṣaraṃ brahmavācakatvāt pratimābaddhabrahmapratīkatvād vā brahma vyāharann uccaran /
analyzed: om iti ekam akṣaram brahma vācaka tvāt pratimā baddha brahma pratīka tvāt vā brahma vyāharan uccaran
translated: Reciting the syllable 'Om', which is Brahman, or which is the symbol of Brahman represented in an image,

original: om iti vyāharann ity etāvataiva nirvāha ekākṣaram ity anāyāsakathanena stutyartham /
analyzed: om iti vyāharan iti etāvatā eva nirvāhaḥ eka akṣaram iti anāyāsa kathanena stuti artham
translated: by merely saying 'reciting the syllable Om', the word 'one syllable' is used for the purpose of praise by stating it without effort.

original: om iti vyāharann ekākṣaram ekam advitīyam akṣaram avināśi sarvavyāpakaṃ brahma mām om ity asyārthaṃ smarann iti vā /
analyzed: om iti vyāharan ekākṣaram ekam advitīyam akṣaram avināśi sarva vyāpakam brahma mām om iti asya artham smaran iti vā
translated: Reciting the syllable 'Om', remembering the meaning of 'Om', which is the one, the secondless, imperishable, all-pervading Brahman.

original: tena praṇavaṃ japaṃs tadabhidheyabhūtaṃ ca māṃ cintayan mūrdhanyayā nāḍyā dehaṃ
analyzed: tena praṇavam japan tad abhidheya bhūtam ca mām cintayan mūrdhanyayā nāḍyā deham
translated: By that, meditating on me, who am the object denoted by the syllable 'Om', through the susumna nerve, the body is

original: tyajanyaḥ prayāti sa yāti devayānamārgeṇa brahmalokaṃ gatvā tadbhogānte paramāṃ
analyzed: tyajan yaḥ prayāti sa yāti deva yāna mārgeṇa brahma lokam gatvā tad bhoga ante paramām
translated: He who renounces goes by the path of the gods to the world of Brahman, and after the end of those enjoyments, to the highest,

original: prakṛṣṭāṃ gatiṃ madrūpām /
analyzed: prakṛṣṭām gatim mad rūpām
translated: excellent, goal, which is of the nature of Me.

original: atra patañjalinā tīvrasaṃvegānām āsannaḥ Ys /
analyzed: atra patañjalinā tīvra saṃvegānām āsannaḥ
translated: Here, Patanjali has said that for those of intense feeling, there is nearness to🔽the attainment of samadhi.

original: samādhilābhaḥ ity uktvā īśvarapraṇidhānād vā / ity uktam /
analyzed: samādhi lābhaḥ iti uktvā īśvara praṇidhānāt vā iti uktam
translated: And it has been said that it is also from the concentration on God.

original: praṇidhānaṃ ca vyākhyātaṃ tasya vācakaḥ praṇavaḥ /
analyzed: praṇidhānam ca vyākhyātam tasya vācakaḥ praṇavaḥ
translated: And concentration has been explained as the syllable Om, which is expressive of that.

original: tajjapas tadarthabhāvanam / iti /
analyzed: tad japaḥ tad artha bhāvanam iti
translated: The repetition of that is the meditation on its meaning.

original: samādhisiddhir īśvarapraṇidhānāt / iti ca /
analyzed: samādhi siddhiḥ īśvara praṇidhānāt iti ca
translated: And the attainment of samadhi is from the concentration on God.

original: iha tu sākṣād eva tataḥ paramagatilābha ity uktam /
analyzed: iha tu sākṣāt eva tatas parama gati lābhaḥ iti uktam
translated: But here it has been said that the attainment of the highest goal is directly from that.

original: tasmād avirodhayom ity ekākṣaraṃ brahma vyāharan mām anusmarann ātmano yogadhāraṇām āsthita iti vyākhyeyam /
analyzed: tasmāt avirodhayā ūm iti ekākṣaram brahma vyāharan mām anusmaran ātmanaḥ yoga dhāraṇām āsthitaḥ iti vyākhyeyam
translated: Therefore, it should be explained that uttering the syllable Om, which is Brahman, remembering Me, and resorting to the yoga-meditation of one's own self.

original: vicitraphalatvopapatter vā na nirodhyaḥ ////
analyzed: vicitra phala tva upapatteḥ vā na nirodhyaḥ
translated: Or, it should not be stopped because of the possibility of various results.

original: viśvanāthaḥ uktam arthaṃ vadan yoge prakāram āha sarvāṇi cakṣurādīndriyadvārāṇi
analyzed: āha
translated: Visvanatha, speaking of the stated meaning, says that in yoga there are various methods. All the doors of the senses like the eyes

original: saṃyamya bāhyaviṣayebhyaḥ pratyāhṛtya manaś ca hṛdy eva nirudhya viṣayāntareṣv asaṅkalpya
analyzed: saṃyamya bāhya viṣayebhyaḥ pratyāhṛtya manaḥ ca hṛdi eva nirudhya viṣaya antareṣu a saṅkalpya
translated: Having withdrawn the mind from external objects, having restrained it in the heart itself, not conceiving it in other objects,

original: mūrdhni bhruvor madhye eva prāṇam ādhāya yogadhāraṇām ānakhaśikhamanmūrtibhāvanām
analyzed: mūrdhni bhruvoḥ madhye eva prāṇam ādhāya yoga dhāraṇām ā nakha śikhamat mūrti bhāvanām
translated: having placed the breath in the middle of the eyebrows, having resorted to the yoga-dhāraṇā, the meditation on one's own form from the nails to the hair,

original: āśritaḥ san om ity ekākṣaraṃ brahmasvarūpaṃ vyāharan uccārayan tadvācyaṃ mām anusmarann
analyzed: āśritaḥ san om iti ekākṣaram brahma svarūpam vyāharan uccārayan tad vācyam mām anusmaran
translated: uttering, pronouncing the one-syllabled Oṃ, which is of the nature of Brahman, remembering Me, who am denoted by that,

original: anudhyāyan paramāṃ gatiṃ matsālokyam // //
analyzed: anudhyāyan paramām gatim mad sālokyam
translated: meditating on the highest goal, my own world, etc.

original: baladevaḥ yogaprakāram āha sarveti /
translated: Balarāma describes the method of yoga, beginning with the word 'sarva' (all).

original: sarvāṇi bahir jñānadvārāṇi śrotrādīni saṃyamya śabdādibhyo viṣayebhyaḥ pratyāhṛtya
analyzed: sarvāṇi bahis jñāna dvārāṇi śrotra ādīni saṃyamya śabda ādibhyaḥ viṣayebhyaḥ pratyāhṛtya
translated: Having withdrawn all the external doors of knowledge, the ears etc., having turned away from sound etc. objects,

original: doṣadarśanābhyāsena tadvimukhais tais tān gṛhṇan śrotrādisaṃyame 'pi manaḥ pracared
analyzed: doṣa darśana abhyāsena tad vimukhaiḥ taiḥ tān gṛhṇan śrotra ādi saṃyame manaḥ pracaret
translated: taking them away from those objects by repeatedly seeing their faults, even when the ears etc. are restrained, the mind may move.

original: ity ata āha hṛdi sthite mayi antarjñānadvāraṃ mano nirudhya niveśya manasāpi tān smaran /
analyzed: iti atas āha hṛdi sthite mayi antar jñāna dvāram manaḥ nirudhya niveśya manasā api tān smaran
translated: Therefore he says: having restrained, placed the mind, the door of internal knowledge, in Me who am situated in the heart, remembering those even with the mind.

original: atha kriyādvāraṃ prāṇaṃ ca mūrdhnādhāyādau hṛtpadme vaśīkṛtya tasmād ūrdhvagatayā
analyzed: atha kriyā dvāram prāṇam ca mūrdhnā ādhāya ādau hṛd padme vaśīkṛtya tasmāt ūrdhva gatayā
translated: Then, having placed the breath, the door of action, in the head, first controlling it in the lotus of the heart, and from there making it go upwards,

original: suṣumṇayā gurūpadiṣṭavartmanā bhūmijayakrameṇa bhruvor madhye tadupari brahmarandhre
analyzed: suṣumṇayā guru upadiṣṭa vartmanā bhūmi jaya krameṇa bhruvoḥ madhye tad upari brahmarandhre
translated: Having placed, through the Suṣumnā nerve, along the path taught by the Guru, in the middle of the eyebrows, above that, in the Brahmarandhra,

original: ca saṃsthāpya ātmano mama yogadhāraṇām āādaśikhaṃ madbhāvanam āsthitaḥ kurvan /
analyzed: ca saṃsthāpya ātmanaḥ mama yoga dhāraṇām āāda śikham mad bhāvanam āsthitaḥ kurvan
translated: my own, my, Yoga-dhāraṇā, having resorted to, performed, the meditation on Me, consisting of the ten-peaked [mantra].

original: om iti vācakaṃ brahma tatra vyāharan antar uccārayan tat stauti ekākṣaram iti ekaṃ
analyzed: om iti vācakam brahma tatra vyāharan antar uccārayan tat stauti ekākṣaram iti ekam
translated: Om, the expressive Brahman, uttering that internally, he praises that one-syllable, the one

original: pradhānaṃ ca tadakṣaram avināśi ceti tathā tad vācyaṃ māṃ parmātmānam anusmaran
analyzed: pradhānam ca tat akṣaram avināśi ca iti tathā tat vācyam mām parma ātmānam anusmaran
translated: principal, and imperishable syllable, remembering Me, the Supreme Self, who is denoted by that.

original: dhyāyan yo dehaṃ tyajan prayāti sa paramāṃ gatiṃ matsālokyatāṃ yāti // //
analyzed: dhyāyan yaḥ deham tyajan prayāti sa paramām gatim mad sālokya tām yāti
translated: He, abandoning the body, goes to the highest goal, attains union with Me.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: ananyacetāḥ satataṃ yo māṃ smarati nityaśaḥ /
analyzed: an anya cetāḥ satatam yaḥ mām smarati nityaśas
translated: He who always, constantly, remembers Me with a mind undivided,

original: tasyāhaṃ sulabhaḥ pārtha nityayuktasya yoginaḥ ////
analyzed: tasya aham sulabhaḥ pārtha nitya yuktasya yoginaḥ
translated: to him, O son of Prtha, I am easy to attain, to the yogi ever devoted.

original: śrīdharaḥ evaṃ cāntakāle dhāraṇayā matprāptir nityābhyāsavata eva bhavati /
translated: Śrīdhara: Thus, the attainment of Me through dhāraṇā at the time of death happens only for one who has constant practice,

original: nānyasyeti pūrvoktam evānusmārayati ananyeti /
analyzed: na anyasya iti pūrva uktam eva anusmārayati ananyā iti
translated: not for anyone else. This is what is being recalled by the words 'anannya-cetāḥ' etc.

original: nāsty anyasmiṃś ceto yasya /
analyzed: na asti anyasmin cetaḥ yasya
translated: He whose mind is not in anything else.

original: tathābhūtaḥ san /
analyzed: tathābhūtaḥ san
translated: Being such,

original: yo māṃ satataṃ nirantaraṃ nityaśaḥ pratidinaṃ smarati /
analyzed: yaḥ mām satatam nirantaram nityaśas pratidinam smarati
translated: He who always, uninterruptedly, constantly, everyday, remembers Me,

original: tasya nityayuktasya samāhitasyāhaṃ sukhena labhyo 'smi nānyasya ////🔽madhusūdanaḥ ya evaṃ vāyunirodhavaidhuryeṇa prāṇam āveśya mūrdhanyayā nāḍyā dehaṃ
analyzed: tasya nitya yuktasya samāhitasya aham sukhena labhyaḥ smi na anyasya  madhusūdanaḥ yaḥ evam vāyu nirodha vaidhuryeṇa prāṇam āveśya mūrdhanyayā nāḍyā deham
translated: I am easily attainable by him who is always concentrated, who is absorbed in meditation, and not by anyone else.

original: tyaktuṃ svecchayā na śaknoti kiṃ tu karmakṣayeṇaiva paravaśo dehaṃ tyajati tasya
analyzed: tyaktum sva icchayā na śaknoti kim tu karma kṣayeṇa eva para vaśaḥ deham tyajati tasya
translated: Madhusudana: One who, due to the absence of the restraint of breath, is unable to give up the body by his own will through the suṣumnā nerve, but who gives up the body under the control of others due to the exhaustion of karma,

original: kiṃ syād iti tad āha ananyacetā iti /
analyzed: kim syāt iti tat āha an anya cetāḥ iti
translated: what happens to him? That is being said: Ananyacetāḥ, whose mind is not in anything else;

original: na vidyate madanyaviṣaye ceto yasya so 'nanyacetāḥ satataṃ nirantaraṃ nityaśo🔽yāvajjīvaṃ yo māṃ smarati tasya svavaśatayā vā dehaṃ tyajato 'pi nityayuktasya🔽satatasamāhitacittasya yoginaḥ sulabhaḥ sukhena labhyo 'haṃ parameśvara itareṣām
analyzed: na vidyate mad anya viṣaye cetaḥ yasya saḥ satatam nirantaram nityaśas  yāvajjīvam yaḥ mām smarati tasya svavaśa tayā vā deham nitya yuktasya  satata samāhita cittasya yoginaḥ sulabhaḥ sukhena labhyaḥ ham parameśvaraḥ itareṣām
translated: he who always, uninterruptedly, constantly,🔽as long as he lives, remembers Me, for him, even though he gives up the body under his own control, I, the Supreme Lord, am easily attainable, easily obtainable, by the yogi who is always concentrated,

original: atidurlabho 'pi he pārtha tavāham atisulabho mā bhaiṣīr ity abhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: he pārtha tava aham ati sulabhaḥ mā bhaiṣīḥ iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: whose mind is always absorbed in meditation. For others, though I am very difficult to attain, O son of Pṛthā, I am very easy to attain for you. Do not be afraid. This is the idea.

original: atra tasyeti ṣaṣṭh /śeṣe sambandhasāmānye /
analyzed: atra tasya iti ṣaṣṭha śeṣe sambandha sāmānye
translated: Here, the genitive ending in 'tasya' is in the sense of relationship in general.

original: kartari na lokety ādinā niṣedhāt /
analyzed: kartari na loka iti ādinā niṣedhāt
translated: Because of the prohibition expressed by the words 'not in the agent' etc.

original: atra cānanyacetastvena satkāro 'tyādaram /
analyzed: atra ca an anya cetaḥ tvena ti ādaram
translated: And here, by the words 'with mind not in anything else', 'satkāra' means great respect.

original: satatam iti nairantaryaṃ nityaśa iti dīrghakālatvaṃ smaraṇasyoktam /
analyzed: satatam iti nairantaryam nityaśas iti dīrgha kāla tvam smaraṇasya uktam
translated: And by the words 'always' and 'continuously', the author has stated the uninterruptedness and long duration of the remembrance.

original: tena sa tu dīrghakālanairantaryasatkārāsevito dṛḍhabhūmiḥ Ys /
analyzed: tena sa tu dīrgha kāla nairantarya satkāra āsevitaḥ dṛḍha bhūmiḥ
translated: Therefore, that (remembrance) which is practised for a long time, uninterruptedly, with great respect, becomes firmly established.

original: iti pātañjalaṃ matam anusṛtaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: iti pātañjalam matam anusṛtam bhavati
translated: Thus, the opinion of Patanjali is followed.

original: tatra sa ity abhyāsa ukto 'pi smaraṇaparyavasāyī /
analyzed: tatra saḥ iti abhyāsaḥ smaraṇa paryavasāyī
translated: There, the word 'that' refers to practice, which culminates in remembrance.

original: tena yāvajjīvaṃ pratikṣaṇaṃ vikṣepāntaraśūnyatayā bhagavadanucintanam eva paramagatihetur mūrdhanyayā nāḍyā tu svecchayā prāṇotkramaṇaṃ
analyzed: tena yāvajjīvam pratikṣaṇam vikṣepa antara śūnya tayā bhagavat anucintanam eva parama gati hetuḥ mūrdhanyayā nāḍyā tu sva icchayā prāṇa utkramaṇam
translated: Therefore, as long as one lives, the cause of the highest goal is the constant thought of the Lord, moment by moment, free from other distractions. But the exit of the vital breath through the suṣumnā nerve is optional.

original: bhavatu na veti nātīvāgrahaḥ ////
analyzed: bhavatu na vā iti na atīva āgrahaḥ
translated: Whether it happens or not, one should not be too attached.

original: viśvanāthaḥ tad evam ārtaḥ ity ādinā karmamiśrām /
translated: Viśvanātha: Thus, with the words 'the distressed one' etc., (the Lord) has spoken of devotion mixed with karma.

original: jaarāmaraṇamokṣāya ity anenāpi karmamiśrām /
analyzed: iti anena api karma miśrām
translated: With the words 'for the sake of liberation from birth and death' also, (the Lord) has spoken of devotion mixed with karma.

original: kaviṃ purāṇaṃ ity ādibhir yogamiśrāṃ ca saparikarāṃ pradhānībhūtāṃ bhaktim uktvā sarvaśreṣṭhāṃ nirguṇāṃ kevalāṃ bhaktim āhaananyacetā iti
analyzed: kavim purāṇam iti ādibhiḥ yoga miśrām ca sa parikarām pradhānībhūtām bhaktim uktvā sarva śreṣṭhām nirguṇām kevalām bhaktim āha an anya cetāḥ iti
translated: Having spoken of devotion, which is the principal (aspect), along with its auxiliaries, mixed with knowledge, with the words 'the ancient knower' etc., (the Lord) now speaks of pure, unqualified devotion, which is the best of all, with the words 'with mind not in anything else' etc.

original: na vidyate 'nyasmin karmaṇi jñānayoge vānuṣṭheyatvena /
analyzed: na vidyate karmaṇi jñāna yoge vā anuṣṭheya tvena
translated: It is not found in any other action or in the practice of knowledge and yoga.

original: tathā devatāntare vārādhyatvena /
analyzed: tathā devatā antare vā ārādhya tvena
translated: Similarly, it is not found in any other deity as one to be worshipped.

original: tathā svargāpargādāv api prāpyatvena ceto yasya /
analyzed: tathā svarga aparga ādau api prāpya tvena cetaḥ yasya
translated: Similarly, it is not found in heaven, liberation, etc. as the goal of the mind.

original: satataṃ sadeti kāladeśapātraśuddhyādyanapekṣatayaiva nityaśaḥ pratidinam eva yo māṃ smarati /
analyzed: satatam sadā iti kāla deśa pātra śuddhi ādi anapekṣa tayā eva nityaśas pratidinam eva yaḥ mām smarati
translated: He who always remembers Me, i.e. who always, every day, without regard to the purity of time, place, vessel, etc., constantly remembers Me.

original: yasya tena bhaktenāhaṃ sulabhaḥ sukhena labhyaḥ /
analyzed: yasya tena bhaktena aham sulabhaḥ sukhena labhyaḥ
translated: I am easily accessible to him, who is such a devotee.

original: yogajñānābhyāsādiduḥkhamiśraṇābhāvād iti bhāvaḥ /
translated: The idea is that I am easily attained by him, because there is no mixture of suffering due to the practice of yoga and knowledge.

original: nityayuktasya nityamadyogākāṅkṣiṇa āśaṃsāyāṃ bhūtavac ceti bhāviny api yoga āśāṃsite ktapratyayaḥ /
analyzed: nitya yuktasya nitya mad yoga ākāṅkṣiṇaḥ āśaṃsāyām bhūta vat ca iti bhāvini api yoge āśāṃsite kta pratyayaḥ
translated: For one who is always in yoga, who always desires yoga, the suffix kta is used for the future yoga that is desired, as in the case of the past, in the optative sense.

original: yogino bhaktiyogavataḥ /
analyzed: yoginaḥ bhakti yogavataḥ
translated: The yogi is one who has devotion.

original: yad vā yogasambandho dāsyasakhyādis
analyzed: yat vā yoga sambandhaḥ dāsya sakhya ādiḥ
translated: Or, he who has the connection with yoga, such as servitude, friendship, etc.

original: tadvataḥ ////
analyzed: tadvataḥ
translated: He who has that.

original: baladevaḥ evaṃ mokṣamātrakāṅkṣiṇāṃ yogamiśrāṃ bhaktim upadiśya svajñānināṃ svam evākāṅkṣatām ekabhaktir ity uktāṃ śuddhāṃ bhaktiṃ upadiśati
analyzed: baladevaḥ evam mokṣa mātra kāṅkṣiṇām yoga miśrām bhaktim upadiśya sva jñāninām svam eva ākāṅkṣatām eka bhaktiḥ iti uktām śuddhām bhaktim upadiśati  /
translated: Balarama: Having thus instructed the devotion mixed with yoga for those who desire only liberation, he instructs the pure devotion called single devotion for those who desire only his own knowledge.

original: ananyeti /
analyzed: ananyā iti
translated: He says Ananyayogayukta (one who is not engaged in any other yoga).

original: yo jano 'nanyacetā na matto 'nyasmin karmayogādike sādhane svargamokṣādike sādhye
analyzed: yaḥ janaḥ na anya cetāḥ na mattaḥ nyasmin karma yoga ādike sādhane svarga mokṣa ādike sādhye
translated: He who has his mind fixed on none else, whose mind is not directed to any other means such as Karma-yoga etc. or to any other end such as heaven or liberation,🔽but who has his mind fixed on Me alone, who is ever and always

original: vā ceto yasya sa madekābhilāṣavān satataṃ sarvadā deśakālādiviśuddhinairapekṣeṇa
analyzed: vā cetaḥ yasya sa mad eka abhilāṣavān satatam sarvadā deśa kāla ādi viśuddhi nairapekṣeṇa
translated: devoid of any regard for the purity of place, time etc.,

original: nityaśaḥ pratyahaṃ māṃ yaśodāstanandhayaṃ nṛsiṃharaghunāthādirūpeṇa bahudhāvirbhūtaṃ
analyzed: nityaśas pratyaham mām yaśodā stanandhayam nṛsiṃha raghunātha ādi rūpeṇa bahudhā āvirbhūtam
translated: who always, everyday, remembers Me, who have manifested Myself in many ways as the child sucking the breast of Yasoda, as Nrsimha, as the Lord of Raghus etc.,

original: sarveśvaram atimātrapriyaṃ smaraty arcanajapādiṣv anusandhatte tasyāhaṃ tatprītijñaḥ
analyzed: sarveśvaram atimātra priyam smarati arcana japa ādiṣu anusandhatte tasya aham tad prīti jñaḥ
translated: who am the Lord of all, who am extremely dear, who am engaged in worshipping and meditating etc., to him I, who am known as his beloved,

original: sulabhaḥ sukhena labhyaḥ karmānuṣṭhānayogābhyāsādiduḥkhasamparkābhāvāt /
analyzed: sulabhaḥ sukhena labhyaḥ karma anuṣṭhāna yoga abhyāsa ādi duḥkha samparka abhāvāt
translated: am easily accessible, am easily obtainable, because of the absence of the necessity of undergoing the difficulties of the performance of rites, of the practice of Yoga etc.

original: tasyeti sambandhasāmānye ṣaṣṭhī /
analyzed: tasya iti sambandha sāmānye ṣaṣṭhī
translated: The genitive case in the expression 'tasya' (his) is in the general sense of relationship.

original: na lokāvyaya ity ādinā kartari tasyāḥ pratiṣedhāt /
analyzed: na loka avyaye iti ādinā kartari tasyāḥ pratiṣedhāt
translated: Because the prohibition of that (genitive case) in the nominative case has been stated by the rule beginning with 'na loka-avyayībhāvaḥ' (Panini 2.1.24).

original: tādṛśasya tasya viyogam asahiṣṇur aham eva tam ātmānaṃ
analyzed: tādṛśasya tasya viyogam asahiṣṇuḥ aham eva tam ātmānam
translated: Being unable to bear the separation of such a one, I Myself

original: darśayāmi tatsādhanaparipākaṃ tatpratikūlanirāsaṃ ca kurvan /
analyzed: darśayāmi tad sādhana paripākam tad pratikūla nirāsam ca kurvan
translated: reveal Myself to him, and by removing the obstacles to the ripening of his means and by destroying what is adverse to it,

original: śrutiś caivam āha yam evaiṣa vṛnute tena labhyas tasyaiṣa ātmā viviṛṇute tanūṃ svām iti /
analyzed: śrutiḥ ca evam āha yam eva eṣa vṛnute tena labhyaḥ tasya eṣaḥ ātmā viviṛṇute tanūm svām iti
translated: and the Shruti also says thus: 'He is to be obtained by him whom He chooses. He reveals His own body to him.' (Mundaka Upanishad 3.2.5).

original: svayaṃ ca vakṣyati dadāmi buddhiyogaṃ taṃ yena mām upayānti te ity ādinā /
analyzed: svayam ca vakṣyati dadāmi buddhi yogam tam yena mām upayānti te iti ādinā
translated: And He Himself will say, 'I give them the yoga of wisdom by which they come to Me,' etc.

original: kīdṛśasyety āha nityeti /
analyzed: kīdṛśasya iti āha nitya iti
translated: Of what kind of person? He says: 'who is ever devoted to Me.'

original: sarvadā madyogaṃ vāñchataḥ āśaṃsāyāṃ bhūtavac ca iti sūtrād āśāṃsite yoge bhaviṣyaty api ktapratyayaḥ /
analyzed: sarvadā mad yogam vāñchataḥ āśaṃsāyām bhūta vat ca iti sūtrāt āśāṃsite yoge bhaviṣyati api ktapratyayaḥ
translated: The kta affix is used in the future sense in the optative, according to the sutra 'In the optative, the future is used as if it were past.'

original: yogino maddāsyasakhyādisambandhavataḥ ////
analyzed: yoginaḥ mad dāsya sakhī ādi sambandhavataḥ
translated: The yogis, who are related to Me as servants, friends, etc.

original: BhG /🔽mām upetya punar janma duḥkhālayam aśāśvatam /
analyzed: bhg  mām upetya punar janma duḥkha ālayam aśāśvatam
translated: BhG 8.15🔽Having come to Me, the great souls do not attain birth again, which is impermanent and the abode of suffering.

original: nāpnuvanti mahātmānaḥ saṃsiddhiṃ paramāṃ gatāḥ ////
analyzed: na āpnuvanti mahātmānaḥ saṃsiddhim paramām gatāḥ
translated: They have attained the highest perfection.

original: śrīdharaḥ yady evaṃ tvaṃ sulabho 'si tataḥ kiṃ /
translated: Shridhar: If You are so easily accessible, then what?

original: ata āha mām iti /
analyzed: atas āha mām iti
translated: Therefore He says 'to Me,' etc.

original: uktalakṣaṇā mahātmāno madbhaktā māṃ prāpya punar duḥkhāśrayam antiyaṃ ca janma na prāpnuvanti /
analyzed: ukta lakṣaṇāḥ mahātmānaḥ mad bhaktāḥ mām prāpya punar duḥkha āśrayam antiyam ca janma na prāpnuvanti
translated: The great souls, who are devotees of Mine, having attained Me, do not attain birth again, which is the abode of suffering and impermanent.

original: yatas te paramāṃ samyak siddhiṃ mokṣam eva prāptāḥ /
analyzed: yatas te paramām samyak siddhim mokṣam eva prāptāḥ
translated: Because they have attained the highest perfection, which is liberation itself.

original: punar janmano duḥkhānāṃ cālayaṃ sthānaṃ te mām upetya na prāpnuvantīti vā ////
analyzed: punar janmanaḥ duḥkhānām ca ālayam sthānam te mām upetya na prāpnuvanti iti vā
translated: Or, they do not attain birth again and the abode of sufferings, having come to Me.

original: madhusūdanaḥ bhagavantaṃ prāptāḥ punar āvartante na veti sandehe nāvartanta ity āha mām iti /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ bhagavantam prāptāḥ punar āvartante na vā iti sandehe na āvartante iti āha mām iti
translated: Madhusudana: In the doubt whether those who have attained the Lord return again or not, it is said that they do not return: mam.

original: mām īśvaraṃ prāpya punar janma manuṣyādidehasambandhaṃ kīdṛśaṃ duḥkhālayaṃ garbhavāsayonidvāranirgamanādyanekaduḥkhasthānam /
analyzed: mām īśvaram prāpya punar janma manuṣya ādi deha sambandham kīdṛśam duḥkha ālayam garbha vāsa yoni dvāra nirgamana ādi aneka duḥkha sthānam
translated: Having attained Me, the Lord, they do not attain birth, which is a connection with a human or other body, of what sort? A home of misery, a place of many miseries such as dwelling in the womb, coming out through the vagina, etc.

original: aśāśvatam asthiraṃ dṛṣṭanaṣṭaprāyaṃ nāpnuvanti punar nāvartanta ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: aśāśvatam asthiram dṛṣṭa naṣṭa prāyam na āpnuvanti punar na āvartante iti arthaḥ
translated: It is impermanent, unstable, mostly destroyed as soon as seen. They do not attain it again, i.e. they do not return.

original: yato mahātmnāno rajastamomalarahitāntaḥkaraṇā śuddhasattvāḥ samutpannasamyagdarśanā mallokabhogānte paramāṃ sarvotkṛṣṭāṃ saṃsiddhiṃ
analyzed: yatas rajaḥ tamaḥ mala rahita antaḥkaraṇā śuddha sattvāḥ samutpanna samyak darśanāḥ mad loka bhoga ante paramām sarva utkṛṣṭām saṃsiddhim
translated: Because those great souls, whose internal organs are free from the impurities of passion and darkness, who are of pure sattva, who have attained perfect knowledge, go to the highest, most excellent perfection,

original: muktiṃ gatās te /
analyzed: muktim gatāḥ te
translated: liberation, at the end of enjoying the world.

original: atra māṃ prāpya siddhiṃ gatā iti vadatopāsakānāṃ kramamuktir darśitā ////
analyzed: atra mām prāpya siddhim gatāḥ iti vadatā upāsakānām krama muktiḥ darśitā
translated: Here, by saying having attained Me, they go to perfection, the gradual liberation of the devotees is shown.

original: viśvanāthaḥ tvāṃ prāptavatas tasya kiṃ syād ity āha mām iti /
analyzed: viśvanāthaḥ tvām prāptavataḥ tasya kim syāt iti āha mām iti
translated: Visvanatha: What happens to one who has attained You? It is said: mam.

original: duḥkhālayaṃ duḥkhapūrṇam /
analyzed: duḥkha ālayam duḥkha pūrṇam
translated: A home of misery, full of misery.

original: aśāśvatam anityaṃ ca janma nāpnuvanti kintu sukhapūrṇaṃ janma majjanmatulyaṃ prāpnuvanti /
analyzed: aśāśvatam anityam ca janma na āpnuvanti kintu sukha pūrṇam janma mad janma tulyam prāpnuvanti
translated: They do not attain birth, which is impermanent and transitory, but attain birth full of happiness, equal to My birth.

original: śāśvatas tu dhruvo nityaḥ sadānanaḥ sanātanaḥ ity amaraḥ /
analyzed: śāśvataḥ tu dhruvaḥ nityaḥ sadānanaḥ sanātanaḥ iti amaraḥ
translated: The Amarakośa says, śāśvataḥ, tu, dhruvaḥ, nityaḥ, sadā, ananaḥ, sanātanaḥ.

original: yadā vasudevagṛhe sukhapūrṇaṃ nityabhūtam aprākṛtaṃ majjanma bhavet tad eva teṣāṃ madbhaktānām api mannityasaṅgināṃ janma syān nānyadā
analyzed: yadā vasudeva gṛhe sukha pūrṇam nitya bhūtam aprākṛtam mad janma bhavet tat eva teṣām mad bhaktānām api mad nitya saṅginām janma syāt na anyadā
translated: When there is my birth, which is full of bliss, eternal, natural, in the house of Vasudeva, then only will there be the birth of those devotees of mine who are always attached to me, not at any other time.

original: iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: iti bhāvaḥ
translated: This is the idea.

original: paramām iti anye bhaktāḥ saṃsiddhiṃ prāpnuvanti ananyacetasas tu paramāṃ saṃsiddhiṃ mallīlāparikaratām ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: paramām iti anye bhaktāḥ saṃsiddhim prāpnuvanti ananya cetasaḥ tu paramām saṃsiddhim mad līlā parikara tām iti arthaḥ
translated: The highest - other devotees attain perfection, but those whose minds are not fixed on anything else attain the highest perfection, the state of being an attendant in my pastimes. This is the meaning.

original: tenoktalakṣaṇebhyaḥ sarvabhaktebhyo dṛśyaśraiṣṭhyaṃ dyotitam ////
analyzed: tena ukta lakṣaṇebhyaḥ sarva bhaktebhyaḥ dṛśya śraiṣṭhyam dyotitam
translated: Thus, the superiority of the visible (world) is shown over all devotees who have the characteristics mentioned above.

original: baladevaḥ tāṃ labdhavataḥ kiṃ phalaṃ syād ity apekṣāyām āha mām iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ tām labdhavataḥ kim phalam syāt iti apekṣāyām āha mām iti
translated: When the question arises of what the benefit would be for one who has attained that, [the Lord] says, mam [verse 11.55].

original: mām uktalakṣaṇam upetya prāpya punaḥ prapañce janma nāpnuvanti nāvartanta ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: mām ukta lakṣaṇam upetya prāpya punar prapañce janma na āpnuvanti na āvartante iti arthaḥ
translated: Having attained me, who is characterized as above, they do not attain birth again in the world of manifestation. The meaning is that they do not return.

original: kīdṛśaṃ janmety āha duḥkhālayaṃ garbhavāsādibahukleśapūrṇam /
analyzed: kīdṛśam janma iti āha duḥkha ālayam garbha vāsa ādi bahu kleśa pūrṇam
translated: What kind of birth? [The Lord] says, duḥkhālayam, full of many troubles such as dwelling in the womb.

original: aśāśvatam anityaṃ dṛṣṭanaṣṭaprāyam śāśvatas tu dhruvo nityaḥ ity amaraḥ /
analyzed: aśāśvatam anityam dṛṣṭa naṣṭa prāyam śāśvataḥ tu dhruvaḥ nityaḥ iti amaraḥ
translated: Aśāśvatam, impermanent, mostly perishing as soon as seen. The Amarakośa says, śāśvataḥ, tu, dhruvaḥ, nityaḥ.

original: yatas te paramāṃ sarvotkṛṣṭāṃ saṃsiddhiṃ gatiṃ mām eva gatā labdhavantaḥ avyakto 'kṣara ity uktas tam āhuḥ paramāṃ gatim iti vakṣyati /
analyzed: yatas te paramām sarva utkṛṣṭām saṃsiddhim gatim mām eva gatāḥ labdhavantaḥ avyakto kṣaraḥ iti uktaḥ tam āhuḥ paramām gatim iti vakṣyati
translated: Because they have attained Me alone, the supreme, the most excellent, perfection, the highest goal. As will be stated: He is called the Unmanifest, the Immutable. They call Him the supreme Goal.

original: kīdṛśās te mahātmāno 'tyudāramnanasaḥ vijñānānandanidhiṃ bhaktaprasādābhimukhaṃ
analyzed: kīdṛśāḥ te vijñāna ānanda nidhim bhakta prasāda abhimukham
translated: What are they like? They are magnanimous, of very noble minds, who, without considering anything else like sharing with Me, the treasure of the bliss of knowledge, who is inclined to favor the devotees,

original: bhaktāyattasarvasvaṃ māṃ vinānyat sārṣṭyādikam agaṇayanto madeekajīvātavo bhavanty
analyzed: bhakta āyatta sarva svam mām vinā anyat sārṣṭi ādikam a gaṇayantaḥ bhavanti
translated: who has made all His possessions dependent on the devotees, become solely devoted to Me.

original: atas te mām eva saṃsiddhiṃ gatāḥ /🔽atrānanyacetaso 'sya svaikāntinaḥ svaniṣṭhebhyaḥ svabhaktebhyaḥ śraiṣṭhyaṃ
analyzed: atas te mām eva saṃsiddhim gatāḥ  sva ekāntinaḥ sva niṣṭhebhyaḥ sva bhaktebhyaḥ śraiṣṭhyam
translated: Therefore, they have attained Me alone as perfection.

original: ucyate ////
analyzed: ucyate
translated: Here, it is said that this one whose mind is fixed on nothing else, the true devotee, is superior to even those who are devoted to Me.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Bhagavad Gita

original: ā brahmabhuvanāl lokāḥ punarāvartino 'rjuna /
analyzed: ā brahma bhuvanāt lokāḥ punarāvartinaḥ rjuna
translated: The worlds up to the abode of Brahma, O Arjuna, are subject to return.

original: mām upetya tu kaunteya punarjanma na vidyate ////
analyzed: mām upetya tu kaunteya punarjanma na vidyate
translated: But, O son of Kunti, having attained Me, there is no rebirth.

original: śrīdharaḥ sarva eva jīvā mahāsukṛtino 'pi jāyante /
translated: The Blessed Lord says: All living beings, even those of great merit, are born.

original: madbhaktās tu tadvan na jāyanta ity āha ābrahmeti /
analyzed: mad bhaktāḥ tu tadvat na jāyante iti āha ābrahma iti
translated: But My devotees are not born like that. This is what is said: up to the abode of Brahma.

original: brahmaṇo bhuvanaṃ satyalokaḥ tam abhivyāpya ////
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ bhuvanam satya lokaḥ tam abhivyāpya
translated: The abode of Brahma is the Satyaloka, which extends beyond that.

original: madhusūdanaḥ bhagavantam upāgatānāṃ samyagdarśinām apunarāvṛttau kathitāyāṃ tato vimukhānām asamyagdarśināṃ punarāvṛttir arthasiddhety
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ bhagavantam upāgatānām samyak darśinām apunarāvṛttau kathitāyām tatas vimukhānām asamyak darśinām punarāvṛttiḥ artha siddhā iti
translated: Madhusudana: When it is said that those who have approached the Lord and are rightly enlightened do not return, then the return of those who turn away from Him and are not rightly enlightened is understood as a matter of course.

original: āha ābrahmeti /
analyzed: āha ābrahma iti
translated: Madhusudana: When it is said that those who have attained the Lord and are rightly enlightened do not return, then the return of those who are averse to Him and are not rightly enlightened is understood.🔽Therefore he says up to the world of Brahma, etc.

original: ābrahmabhuvanāt bhavanty atra bhūtānīti bhuvanaṃ lokaḥ /
analyzed: ā brahma bhuvanāt bhavanti atra bhūtāni iti bhuvanam lokaḥ
translated: Bhuvana means a world, from which beings come.

original: abhividhāv ākāraḥ /
analyzed: abhividhau ākāraḥ
translated: Abhividha means a form.

original: brahmalokena saha sarve 'pi lokā madvimukhānām asamyagdarśināṃ bhogabhūtayaḥ punarāvartinaḥ punarāvartanaśīlāḥ /
analyzed: brahma lokena saha sarve pi lokāḥ mad vimukhānām asamyak darśinām bhoga bhūtayaḥ punarāvartinaḥ punarāvartana śīlāḥ
translated: All the worlds along with the world of Brahma are objects of enjoyment for those who are averse to Me and are not rightly enlightened. They are subject to return, i.e., they return again and again.

original: brahmabhavanād iti pāṭhe bhavanaṃ vāsasthānam iti sa evārthaḥ /
analyzed: brahma bhavanāt iti pāṭhe bhavanam vāsa sthānam iti saḥ eva arthaḥ
translated: If the reading is brahmabhavanat, bhavana means a dwelling place, so the meaning is the same.

original: he 'rjuna svataḥprasiddhamahāpuruṣa /
analyzed: he rjuna svatas prasiddha mahā puruṣa
translated: O Arjuna, O man of great fame known to all.

original: kiṃ tadvad eva tvāṃ prāptānām api punar āvṛttir nety āha mām īśvaram ekam upetya tu /
analyzed: kim tadvat eva tvām prāptānām api punar āvṛttiḥ na iti āha mām īśvaram ekam upetya tu
translated: Is it that even those who have attained You like that do not return? He says, But having come to Me, the one God, etc.

original: tur lokāntaravailakṣaṇyadyotanārtho 'vadhāraṇārtho vā /
analyzed: tuḥ loka antara vailakṣaṇya dyotana arthaḥ vā
translated: But indicates the difference from other worlds, or it has the sense of restriction.

original: mām eva prāpya nirvṛttānāṃ he kaunteya mātṛto 'pi prasiddhamahānubhāva punarjanma na vidyate punarāvṛttir nāstīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: mām eva prāpya nirvṛttānām he kaunteya prasiddha mahā anubhāva punarjanma na vidyate punarāvṛttiḥ na asti iti arthaḥ
translated: O son of Kunti, those who have attained Me alone, have attained the highest state of being, for them, even from the mother's womb, there is no rebirth, the meaning is there is no return.

original: atrārjuna kaunteyeti sambodhanadvayena svarūpataḥ kāraṇataś ca śuddhir jñānasaṃpattaye sūcitā /
analyzed: atrā arjuna kaunteya iti sambodhana dvayena svarūpataḥ kāraṇataḥ ca śuddhiḥ jñāna saṃpattaye sūcitā
translated: Here, by the two salutations O Arjuna and O son of Kunti, purity from form and cause is indicated for the attainment of the perfection of knowledge.

original: atreyaṃ vyavasthā /
analyzed: atra iyam vyavasthā
translated: Here is the rule:

original: ye kramamuktiphalābhirupāsanābhir brahmalokaṃ prāptās teṣām eva tatrotpannasamyagdarśanānāṃ brahmaṇā saha mokṣaḥ /
analyzed: ye krama mukti phalābhiḥ upāsanābhiḥ brahma lokam prāptāḥ teṣām eva tatra utpanna samyak darśanānām brahmaṇā saha mokṣaḥ
translated: For those who have attained the world of Brahman through the meditations that result in gradual liberation, for them, having attained perfect knowledge there itself, there is liberation along with Brahman.
